inn1.comm: pitches it up outside off, no movement, Dilshan pushes at it
good ball, lovely length, bit of movement, good bounce, and Dilshan is beaten as he starts to play
well bowled, Jimmy! That hits the same spot and moves away from the bat as Dilshan, not moving his feet, plays down the wrong line, good bowling
now that's a leave, as Dilshan judges the line and lift and shoulders arms, Anderson has hit all the right areas so far, super over so far
swing and a miss! Dilshan thinks about heaving that one across the line, the ball pitches back of a length and then deviates and he misses completely
off the mark now, not too convincingly mind you, as he feels for a shorter ball outside off and manages to pinch a single wide of backward point
starts off short of a length outside off, Dilshan gets up and pushes the ball to point
flashes at one pitched up fractionally more than the last one, beaten by the lack of footwork and the gentle movement
back of a length on the stumps, Dilshan stands tall and allows the ball come on, then pushes it down to mid-off and runs for the quick single
bad ball, full down the leg side, Jayasuriya misses, Prior misses, and the ball is down to the ropes
on the stumps and he plays it to square leg

top ball and that's edged! Really a gem of a delivery from Onions, pitched up, no room to work with, lures Jayasuriya forward, then deviates ever so gently as he pushes at it and the thin nick is snapped up by Prior
pitches outside leg, sits up and Sangakkara, playing from inside his crease, misses it and it strikes him high above the flap
full and he drives it to mid-off
better length, gets some good carry, Dilshan shoulders arms
oh well held Morgan! Anderson gets his man, pitching it up outside off stump, Dilshan has a full-blooded drive at that but Morgan at backward point cups a good low catch
lovely outswinger, on a length just outside off stump, moves away and beats a defensive prod
short of a good length and beats the bat again
hits a length and Jayawardene pushes the ball to Morgan
leans into a fullish ball and drives handsomely to mid-off
back of a length on leg stump, worked nicely to midwicket
good carry off a length, sits up and deviates, left alone this time
too fine, strays down the wrong line and gets too much swing, so Jayawardene clips it down to fine leg for four
ah, sharp bounce! Bangs that it short of a length, spits up and Jayawardene pushes at hesitantly and does well to get a hand off the ball, which bobs up safely
pitches outside leg stump, sits up again and Sangakkara falls over as he plays it, sharp movement back in on that occasion
pitches outside off stump, moves sharply away, Jayawardene had stared to walk down but Anderson saw him and bowled it wide
not more than a defensive push to a full ball on the stumps, and it beats Anderson and mid-on, who runs after it to collect
bowling! Lovely ball, pitched up outside off, sucking Jayawardene forward but then deviating away late and sharp to leave him hanging his bat out, superb ball
now he walks into the shot and pushes the ball past the covers
Anderson holds back the length and moves the ball away from Jayawardene who comfortably shoulders arms
gone, gone! Anderson does indeed pitch it up and this one is the inswinger, catching Jayawardene dead in front, late on the shot, beaten by the late swing
pitches it up on the stumps and he plays it back solidly
edged and gone! Another one goes, its Sangakkara this time, chasing a full and wide ball leaving him and he can only edge it Strauss at first slip, who cups it in front of his face, Australian style
full outside leg stump, misses it all, Kandamby is late to get the bat down and Aleem Dar signals wide
short of a length outside leg stump, Kandamby shuffles and works the ball to midwicket and calls for the risky single
down the pads, worked to midwicket, runs the one, thinks about two
down the pads, wrong line, clipped away to fine leg
well bowled, well played, short of a length, gets Kandamby standing tall and he plays it down with soft hands
change of pace, pitches it up and then gets late movement to beat Samaraweera, groping in the dark outside off stump, superb delivery that
oh whats that! Fuller ball, the inswinger, Samaraweera pushes at it feebly and gets an inside edge onto his pads, that makes the difference else he was bowled
shorter in length, sits up sharply, wide called for height
good judgment from Samaraweera, leaves this one pitched up just outside off stump
pitches it up again, this time Samaraweera gets in line and defends
change of pace, searches for the yorker, doesn't quite get it right and Samaraweera clears the front leg and defends it back, well bowled again
pitches outside off, no swing, and he shoulders arms
starts coming forward, starts to play and then leaves but the ball moves and clips the outer half of his bat and rolls to backward point
well played, the ball tails in from a full length and Samaraweera clips it with the late movement into the gap at midwicket
sharp ball, rises up off a short length, Kandamby rises with the bounce and plays it late and with an angled bat down toward gully
back of a length, stays close to the ball and pushes it past point
short of a length outside leg and Kandamby defends with ease
good ball, and well left! Onions bends his back and gets the ball to angle across Kandamby at a good height but he reads it well, getting out of the way in time
runs it down to third man for a single
short ball, rises into Kandamby who plays it awkwardly down to his feet
too short this time and it sails over the batsman to Prior
short of a length and he plays the ball to point
fuller in length, angling across Kandamby who leaves
pitched up closer to the stumps, hint of movement, Kandamby pushes at it and turns it toward midwicket
good ball, pitches back of a length and then straightens to square up Samaraweera, who pushes at it and sends the ball dribbling to cover
starts off pitching wide of off stump, Samaraweera leaves it be
fuller in length and Samaraweera punishes the loose ball with a firm off-drive, beating mid-off for four, that will give him some confidence
shot! Samaraweera reads the length excellently and transfers the weight, flashing the shorter ball into the gap between cover and point, well played man
better length, middle and off, and he plays it back to Broad
well bowled, pitches and straightens and he pushes to midwicket
short of a length and he forces it off the back foot to point
good ball, pitches it up and shapes it back into Kandamby who gets the bat down just in time
well bowled, late movement beats him as he feels for the ball, it angles across and just slips past the outer edge with the sharp outswing
similar ball but he decides not to play at this one
good angle from Anderson again, shaping the ball away from Kandamby who thinks about playing at it but twirls the bat out of harm's way
bad ball, outside leg stump and he turns it away but Denly pulls off a good dive to save four, that's the effort they want
goes back to angling the ball across Kandamby who leaves
pitches it up and he defends watchfully
short of a length outside off, Samaraweera plays away from his body and chops the ball into the ground in front of point
rises on the toes and tries to force this ball away but mistimes
short ball down the leg side, Samaraweera rises and works it off his hips toward short fine leg, well played that time
stays in his crease, starts to walk across the sticks, and taps the ball pitching outside leg stump wide of the man at midwicket
wrong line from Broad, slips too straight and Samaraweera can easily deflect a single between square leg and midwicket
pitches it up and the ball strays too fine with the inswing, Samaraweera nearly falls over as he plays at the ball and manages to bunt it wide of midwicket
pitches it up and moves it across with the angle, beating the bat
full ball a foot outside off, swings late, Kandamby leaves
shorter ball, pitches just outside leg stump, sits up, Kandamby does well to get on top of the bounce and turn his wrists to keep the ball down
slower ball, pitched up in search of the yorker, Kandamby picks it and steers it down into the gap between slip and gully
full on the pads and he twirls it away for a single
a bit too wide outside off stump, gets some swing but Samaraweera can easily cover off stump and shoulder arms
a bit too full and he drives sweetly to extra cover for one
too far from the stumps and a wide is the result
terrible ball, two feet outside leg stump
better ball, better length, Kandamby gets back and defends
shuffles across early, Broad drops it in short, Kandamby defends
short ball to end the over, easily left be for Prior
starts off with a short ball, too short in fact, and wide is called

oh that's nasty! Onions bangs it short outside off stump and gets sharp lift, Samaraweera is surprised and does well to play that in the end, wasn't pretty but he knocked it down into the gap safely, head going one way, eyes elsewhere
wrong line, strays down the pads and that's worked away
slapped! Short, wide and Kandamby gets over the ball and bisects two men square on the off side for four, comfortably played by the burly left-hander
pitches it up this time, Kandamby gets onto the front foot and firmly pushes the ball to cover
short and he pulls it down into the gap at midwicket
pitches it up outside off, Kandamby gets across and leaves
good length ball, pushes it back, Broad tumbles to stop
fuller in length outside off, carved across the line to midwicket
good ball, very straight, on the stumps, and pushed back
overpitched this time, about a foot and a bit outside off stump, Samaraweera chases it but misses
short ball now, cuts back in to Samaraweera who hops up and takes it near the midriff
too full and wide, gentle swing but too far away from the bat
full on off stump, gently turned wide of midwicket
on the pads and worked away wide of square leg
shorter length, Kandamby gets back and across and stabs at the ball, half intent on forcing it away but the change of pace gets him defending it back
back to a fuller length and he defends sturdily to the off
well bowled, Onions holds back the length and angles the ball across, Kandamby pushes down the wrong line and is beaten for bounce
a bit too wide now and he leaves it be comfortably
comes onto the front foot tentatively and defends to point
he's doing well now, Broad, pitching it up on the stumps, Samaraweera drops his head and defends watchfully back down the track
full again, just outside off stump, good carry through to Prior as Samaraweera opts to leave that one be
back of a length, nearly squared up, ends up defending to cover
nope, wrong line, too far from off stump and wide is the call
digs in a short one outside off stump, Samaraweera hops up and pushes the ball to point, yelling to his partner to stay put
sharp bite off the pitch, again its short and this time jags back into Samaraweera, who gets an inside edge onto his thighs, very well bowled
short of a length again and now Samaraweera defends well
well played, its a bit wide but Kandamby rides the bounce and steers it down wide of slips and gully, a very controlled shot there
too full and he clips the wrists to send the ball flying between midwicket and mid-on, very well played, but that ball needed to be put away
shot! This time he overpitches on off stump and Samaraweera presents a firm push down the ground, beating mid-on safely for four more
good delivery, back of a length, change of pace too, Samaraweera feels for it outside off stump and misses, the ball doesn't carry to Prior
short ball down the leg side, Samaraweera flinches,wide called
hits a good length just outside off stump to get Samaraweera defending
cuts back in off a length, slower ball, Samaraweera goes for a cramped cut off the back foot and mistimes it to backward point
rides the bounce of a short ball outside leg stump and works it fine
short of a length outside off, he stabs at it and runs it to third man
short ball, lifts up sharply off the deck, too poor a delivery at this stage and Kandamby tries a cramped attempt at an uppercut and edges it safely over Prior
back of a length, chance of pace, easily steered to point

a wicket just when it seemed England were losing the plot! Broad locates his radar, pitches on a far better and fuller length as he searches for swing, Samaraweera goes for a hard-handed drive and pops an easy catch to Collingwood at backward point
welcomes him with a snorter, sits up off a crack and rears into Mathews who arches back and manages to play the ball down in front of the fielders
short of a length outside leg stump, turned to square leg
short of a length on off stump and Mathews gets tall to defend
short ball again, sits up and takes the edge as Mathews pushes at it off tiptoes, but the ball doesn't carry to Prior
fuller now and he drives it back without much footwork, not timed to perfection but Mathews has hit it straight back past Wright and the outfield does the rest
forces off the back foot this time, early into the shot, Wright fields
bad ball, sheer trash, miles outside off stump
good ball, short of a length outside off, kisses the edge but falls short and wide of slip and runs away to third man
searches for the yorker and Kandamby defends to the off side
a bit too short and Mathews pushes it to cover off the back foot
full and wide, bit of swing outside off, easily left alone
short of a length and he defends off the back foot
smacked, gets over the short ball this time and pulls past midwicket
more rubbish, way too wide outside off stump, bad stuff from Broad
better ball, fuller in length, Mathews defends it back
fuller length outside off and he pushes into the gap at cover-point
fuller again, middle and off, turned with an inside edge to square
outside leg and turned uppishly down to Swann at fine leg

moves about his crease, Wright holds back the length, Mathews forces the ball square on the off side, Collingwood fields and returns to throw back to the stumps as Mathews is shooed back by Kandamby, the ball hits Mathews' bat and ricochets away for a couple more
short of a length, Mathews gets tall and defends it back
similar ball and again he defends it back
lands it on leg stump and Kandamby turns it to midwicket
comes onto the front foot, opens the face and guides it past gully
the wide bug has hit Collie too, serving it down Mathews' pads
defends off the back foot with an inside edge
full and wide outside off, shoulders arms with ease
again he pitches it wide of the stumps and Mathews leaves
nips back in from middle and leg, Mathews works it with an inside edge and picks out the gap behind square leg, runs excellently and gets two more

full ball, straight drive, hits the stumps and then somehow deflects wide of mid-off and reaches the ropes, Shah heads the wrong way, Onions gives chase and cannot stop four, you don't see that too often ... I mean the ball ricocheting off the stumps for four, not Onions not stopping four
gets back and pushes the ball to the off side
gets back and runs the ball late off the face, Collingwood intercepts
a wee bit short and wide and he back-cuts it wide of Collingwood
short ball on the body, nicely turned just to midwicket
fuller ball and Mathews defends solidly off the front foot
pitches it up and gets Kandamby pushing and edging wide of gully
full outside off stump, a bit too wide, Prior collects
shorter in length, he steers it down to third man
pitches it up now, Kandamby gets an inside edge to square
still he persists with a shorter length to Mathews, who forces it off the back foot wide of gully
and again, continues with full and wide to Kandamby, who leaves
well played, that one is a wide half-volley which he caresses past a diving cover fielder out to the sweeper
spins down the pads, slow turn, brushed off the pads
what a shot! Kandamby waits for the ball to drift away from outside off stump and then delightfully runs it off the face of the bat very fine for four
tossed up fuller and he pats it back to Swann
spins too far down the pads for a wide ... not again!
better ball, good overspin on that one and he defends it back
tosses it up outside off, Kandamby presses forward
good flight but a bit wide and he drives into the off side
pitches on the stumps and he defends
pitches on a length and he steers it to backward point
shorter in length, he waits for the ball and runs it to third man
fuller in length, Mathews leaves, Prior collects
gets back and punches a shorter ball square on the off side, where Anderson trips and misfields in the covers
fuller ball and he square-drives it into the gap for a couple
flat on the pads, worked away for a single
flighted outside off and Kandamby drives well to extra cover
tossed up on middle and off, Mathews clips in style
shorter and flatter, Kandamby shuffles across and works it away
reaches across and tries the paddle but misses, Prior kicks it away
quicker ball, good turn, Mathews tries to turn it away but mistimes
jaffa from Collie! Pitches on a good length and curls the ball away from Kandamby as he walks out and looks to on-drive
steps out again and connects on the flick but can't pick the gap
short ball this time and he dabs it toward point and cover
goes back to a full length, Mathews steers it to gully
full again and he defends to the off side
bit of wobble off the seam this time, as Mathews comes onto the front foot and pinches a quick single in front of Morgan at backward point
drifts down the pads and he works it away for one
tossed up wider to Kandamby, who chases it and slashes in the air over cover
fuller ball, outside off, Mathews tries to turn it across his pads but gets an inside edge
heaved and heaved into the gap, gets across his front pad and swings the ball from outside off with the turn and beats square leg and fine leg for four
tossed up and he defends to the off side
pushed to point
pitches it up and he defends it firmly off the front foot
pushes at one that gets some zip on it and misses, he was looking to cheekily run that down but was undone by the lift off the track
well played, Kandamby! Gets across and nudges the ball off his pads for a single that raises a very good half-century from 71 deliveries
stoutly defends this one up to cover
looks for the yorker, Mathews clears his front leg and clips the ball in the air just wide of square leg
back of a length, Kandamby gets in line and defends
Mathews gets forward and defends watchfully
wonderful shot from Mathews, a bit of width provided, Mathews opens the afce and steers the ball to third man
length ball, turning in, Mathews gets across and turns the ball behind square leg
another easy single, clipped towards square leg by Kandamby
Mathews gets another risk-free single, this time behind square leg to end the over
Collingwood sends down an accurate offstump delivery, blocked back to the bowler
Prior is struck on the shoulder after Mathews misses an outside off delivery that rises sharply
down the leg side, Mathews shuffles across and glances it to deep square leg
the ball sneaks between bat and pad as Kandamy tries to defend off the backfoot
far more solid defence this time from Kandamby, patted back to the bowler
England get excited after Kandamby is struck on the pad, but that was much too high to interest the umpire
short of length, just outside off, pushed towards the off side
closer to the offstump this time, Mathews shows the full face of the bat as he defends
ooh, that was close, Mathews waltzes down the track and tries to loft it over mid-on, just about manages it with a mistimed shot
back of a length, its defended towards point by Mathews
wonderful shot, Mathews shuffled across the stumps early, Onions send down a short ball, Mathews pulls it to fine leg for a boundary
slightly fuller this time, Mathews gets on the back foot and blocks it
pitches it up and he pushes the ball down the track
walks down the track and clips the ball off his pads for one
good ball, hits the seam and a crack and sits up to beat the bat as Mathews feels for it outside off stump
clips with the swing and picks the gap at midwicket
back of a length and defended
good stump-to-stump stuff, Mathews gets in line and blocks
goes to cut but the ball jumps up off a short length and beats him
loud appeal from bowler and wicketkeeper as Onions hustles Kandamby with one that hits the deck and cuts back in, but the ball brushed his thigh not bat, good call from Billy Bowden
outside leg stump and he neatly works the ball to midwicket
beaten by the sharp away movement and bounce as Onions hits the deck hard
jumps down the track and has a go at one pitched up this time but gets beaten by the movement, that was an ugly shot from Mathews, after which Kandamby walks down and has a word
turns a yorker aimed at leg stump to square leg
pitches on a length and he pushes it away
good ball, on a length and he defends it back watchfully
gets forward and runs it wide of backward point

snapped! Short of a length outside off, Kandamby taps it to cover and runs off, it was his call but Mathews turns him down, two men converge and Wright to has plenty of time to return the ball to Prior with Kandamby down the track
back of a length and he defends
hops up and taps the ball away
short of a length and he punches sweetly off the back foot past cover
fuller ball and he plods that back watchfully
full outside off stump and he shoulders arms
takes a step down, Wright drags back the length, Mathews plays to cover
fuller outside off and he shoulders arms
pitches it right up and Kula defends it back solidly

and he gets fifty fortuitously, hopping up to work a short ball away but getting a leading edge that flies to the left of a leaping Collingwood at backward point, good innings from young Mathews and he needs to keep on going here
bad ball from Onions, serving well down Kula's pads
back of a length and Kula tentatively defends to the off
fuller on leg stump and he defends down to mid-on
short of a length and he gets up to defend again
searches for the yorker on leg stump and he clips to square leg

drama, plenty of drama! Too straight from Onions, Mathews gets up and works the ball into the gap at square leg, runs the first hard, turns back for the second and runs into Onions, then stumbles, and in the meantime Prior collects the ball and effects the run out ... Mathews stands mid-pitch and protests that Onions was blocking him but he is ruled out walks off, shaking his head ... England celebrate but then look on in frustration as Mathews is called back .... in fact it is Strauss who called Mathews back ... unlike Collingwood against New Zealand last summer when a similar incident happened at The Oval ...just an accident, or too generous a decision from Strauss?
full length and Mathews defends it back
gets back and works a single
smacked! Gets aerial and slaps a short ball over a leaping backward point
gets back and across and punches a single
gone! End of a good innings as Wright pitches on a good length and gets some gentle movement to draw the outside edge, Prior dives forward and takes the catch
biffs his first ball over mid-off, he's not sticking around!
bouncer, Kula arches back and goes for a shot but misses
short again, not as sharp, and this time he runs it to third man
hello, he's smacked the boxers off that one! Murali! What a guy, just backs away and smacks the length ball over mid-on for maximum, bad ball to bowl
much fuller from Broad but same intent from Murali, swinging across the line and missing by not much
serves up a yorker which Murali squeezes to point
hah, what fun! Broad aims for the yorker again but doesn't nail it and Murali swipes and swipes well, beating short fine leg
pitches in line but swings down too much, Kula is late on the flick and gets rapped high and clearly down leg stump, Anderson appeals in vain
full again and this time Kula defends toward point and sets off

tough, tough chance but its dropped! Strauss nearly pulls off a great catch, running back from square leg as Murali top-edges another chip across the line, he covers a long way, cups the ball, but lets it out .. can't be too harsh on him
fires in the attempted yorker to Murali, who exposes all the sticks, heaves, and gets an inside edge onto the pads for a single
full on Kula's pads and he works away a single
almost a yorker, Murali backs away and jams it out for one
backs away and flashes but cannot connect outside off
bye! Full and straight, Murali swings, misses, and the top of off stump goes flying
bowled him! That's an easy one for Broad, just pitching it up and beating the bat as Malinga tries a dinky little dab, again off stump is pegged back
well played, gets his bat out in front of the pad and defends a full, straight ball to the off side
beaten on this one, Broad holding back the length and straightening the ball to Mendis who pushes inside the line and misses
full down the pads, Mendis neatly works that away for one
nice and full, just outside off, and Mendis plays and misses
gets nicely in line and defends a length ball soundly
gets across and turns a single off his pads
too full on the toes and clipped away to raise the 200
full and straight but Mendis is right in line, defending well
fuller and wider this time, beating the bat as Mendis feels for it
shot! Gets up in the air, arches his back, and flays a short ball ferociously over deep backward point for six, that's the shot of a batsman, mind you
much, much fuller and Kula drives it back to Broad
backs away and drives the full ball to extra cover, Mendis says nope
full toss this time, which Kula hops back and pats to Broad
short ball down the leg side, Kula hops up and deflects it for one
short ball into the body, he takes his eyes off it and defends and the ball runs in front of square leg
full and straight, Mendis gets in line and plays it back
short ball, digs it in to Mendis who flails and bunts it to square leg
low full toss driven down to long-off for another single
good shot, very positively played by Mendis, getting in line and on-driving the full and straight ball between midwicket and mid-on
yorker outside off, beats the bat as Kula chases it

taken by Collingwood? Yes? No? Its not a catch say the umpires ... Wright pitches very full, Kula drives while making room, seemingly slicing it into the ground before it pops up to backward point where Collingwood tumbles to his left, catches it, and straightaway asks how legit his effort was .. tons of replays later the verdict is not out ... one of those that were too close to call
short and wide, sits up sharply, Mendis chases, misses, wide is called
pitches it up wide and he leaves it be
hits a length and beats Mendis off the back foot
good catch by Strauss at slip, diving forward to cup an outside edge low, Mendis stays in his crease and pushes at the ball and Anderson ends a very good evening personally

inn2.comm: starts off full outside off stump, good carry to Sangakkara as Strauss safely opts to leave well enough alone
good ball, pitches in line with the stumps and cuts back to Strauss who gingerly  gets across and nudges it to midwicket to get England on board
short of a length, sits up to test Denly, who does well to defend it down in front of point, standing in his crease
again, no room on offer, stump-to-stump length delivery, Denly stands in line and defends compactly
too straight, getting some swing down Denly's pads, he shuffles to nudge the ball away but it clips the pads and dribbles to the off side
good ball, pitches leg stump and squares up Denly, again the ball rolls to the off side ... and Malinga has overstepped so we have a free hit
well done from Malinga, slips in a slower ball short of a length and just outside off stump, Denly tries to force it away through the covers but fails to connect
pitches it up near off stump, Strauss has a look and leaves be
beaten by the angle, pitches outside leg and darts across Strauss who pushes down the wrong line
similar ball, this time he leaves it be at the last second
leaves this one be with ease outside off stump

peach of a delivery! Beats Strauss for lateral movement, his feet going nowhere as he pushes at one that seams across, Sangakkara takes and appeals loudly, then Kulasekara turns and gently asks the questions, Strauss doesn't react, and replays reveal no edge
identical ball but now Strauss leaves it be
back of a length and Denly defends with promise, pinching one
pitches it up, Strauss gets up and taps it down gently
slower ball, full and straight, takes the outer edge of Strauss' bat as he pushes at it, nearly squared up, the ball flies into the gap near backward point
full outside off stump, no shot offered
beaten! Strauss has a go with the cut but that ball was too full and cramped him for room as it tailed back in after pitching
grunts as he holds back the length outside off, Strauss leaves
takes a step out and Kulasekara holds back the length, cutting the ball into Denly's midriff with appreciable bounce
tidy bowling and tidy defensive stuff from Denly, taking a step out and then waiting to defend the ball back to the bowler
safest place to score your runs! Denly pokes at the inswinger, Kulasekara's natural delivery, and gets an inside edge back past leg stump that beats fine leg
sharp movement and bounce again, Denly is nearly cut in half as the ball jags back off a superb length and raps him in the midriff

now that is good bowling! Kulasekara, after a series of length balls that surprised Denly for bounce, pitches one up and uses his stock delivery to send him back, pitches and moves in to hit him on the pads in front of middle stump, just a fatal second too late on the defensive
good length ball and Shah defends watchfully
pushes well forward to a wide yorker and sets off, Shah says wait
full and straight, moves back late, pushed down to mid-on
takes on the short ball, pulling it well wide of short fine leg
superb ball, very full, very straight, crafty slower yorker and Shah does well to jam that out and get off the mark in a hurry
smacks a short, wide ball and Dilshan saves runs at point, well done
lovely yorker tailing down leg stump, and well played too, Strauss just getting his bat down on ball to clip it wide of Kulasekara at fine leg
sharp movement from outside off stump, cuts back and hits Shah on the flap, Kulasekara starts to appeal but realises it was too high
stands up and punches off the back foot to cover for one
too straight and Shah deflects it off his pads to square leg
brave leave that to one pitched up just outside off stump and tailing back in, Strauss knows where his sticks are and shoulders arms well
wide ball and Strauss chases it from his crease, missing
this time he reaches out and connects, but cant beat point
full ball angles across and leaves him as he shoulders arms
pitches it up in search of swing and gets some, gently leaving Shah off the seam, he is comfortable shouldering arms ala Strauss
full again, a foot outside off, seams away, Shah leaves
three identical balls, Shah has a long look and opts to leave
just a bit too far outside off, Dar has a look but doesn't react
pitched up in that channel and Shah is still happy leaving
and again, full outside off, bit of seam, and Shah says no thanks
well stopped, Mathews! Strauss fairly crunches the ball off the back foot and Mathews dives to his right to save four, athletic fielding at cover
back of a length, Strauss gets back and pushes to cover

oh what a catch, what a catch! Kandamby! Kuleya drags it marginally short, Strauss rocks back and pulls and Kandamby at short midwicket sticks out his right hand and just plucks it, that ball was smacked but he pulled off a stunner
positive intent first up, walking into the shot, pushing it down the track wide of the bowler, Shah loses balance and falls over but mid-on does not have a shy
slides down Collingwood's pads, Sangakkara dives and collects and appeals ... not sure what for, there was clearly no bat involved
more sharp movement, but that is the wrong line, brushes Collingwood's pads and runs wide of square leg
full again, moving back in, too straight, rubs his pads
full again, gently seaming it away, Collie opts to leave
beaten! Gem of a ball, pitched up much closer to off stump, sucking Collingwood forward, gets some bounce too and skims the bat ... that was so close to an edge
good shot, cracked off the back foot to extra cover, Malinga collects and releases and misses as the batsman dives to make his ground
oh, that one straightened and came very close to the top of off stump after Shah came forward and shouldered arms
full and wide, asking for Shah to have a go but he's not biting
now he gets bat on ball, getting over a fuller one and defending
takes two steps down the crease, looking to negate Kuleya's natural inswinging deliveries, this ball is short and clips his pads before rolling to point
sharp movement off the track, fuller in length, raps him on the pads after coming in from outside off, was probably doing too much and Collingwood had stepped out
sweet shot! Collingwood advances and now pulls it off, clipping with the natural inswing and going over the top superbly, dumping that over midwicket for six
too straight and too predictable, Collingwood shuffles and nudges the moving ball down the pads and beats Sangakkara and fine leg
too good! Collingwood skips across and down, covering the movement, and flicks the ball over square leg, excellent placement from him
tries it again but the length is not as full, the ball pitches and clips his pads
back of a length, surprises Shah for movement and bounce and he takes a hand off it as he forces the ball down to a diving backward point
lovely shot, just leans into the full ball and perforates the gap at cover
short of a length, he gets up and forces it back to Mathews
pitches it up just outside off and Collingwood leaves be
what placement! Mathews pitches it straight, Collingwood doesn't so much as just cock his wrists to send the ball flying between two men at midwicket
short of a length outside off stump, Collingwood forces it off the back foot into the gap at cover and keeps hold of the strike
floats up the ball outside off, turns in, Collingwood defends
beaten! That one hurried onto him and left him ever so slightly
too straight and Collingwood gently knocks that to midwicket
Shah starts to press forward and then holds back as the ball straightens past the outer edge
quicker one, googly, pitched up outside off, Shah gets in line to cut and nearly misses
floated up on middle and leg and Shah pats it back
comes onto the front foot and pushes the ball to cover
short of a length and he gets tall, pushing to cover again
leaves one pitched up outside off and sitting up nicely
back of a length, no room to work with, Collingwood defends
dances down, Mathews sees him coming and drags it short, so Collingwood can only readjust and defend
pitches it up outside, gets some movement, Collingwood leaves
just over mid-off, Mendis floats it up and Shah thumps it in the air, the fielder leaps up but the ball just beats his fingertips
googly, too straight, Shah pushes it back watchfully
floats it up again, Shah gets a stride in and defends
another googly, middle and off, Shah stabs at it and gets an inside edge that dribbles into the leg side for a single
too short, Collingwood pushes it to Dilshan at short cover
flicks it up on middle and leg, some turn, Collingwood inside-edges
good length outside off, Shah watchfully pushes to point
takes a step down, Mathews drops short, Shah defends gingerly
taps the ball to point and sets off, smart call to get Collingwood down
short and wide and punched square for a single
gets across to outside off stump and nudges the ball past square leg
yowza! Collingwood skips out and gets tangled with a short ball that kicks up and takes him by surprise, all ends well as he nudges it down and turns back to his crease
full and he unleashes a meaty biff over mid-on down the fielder
quicker delivery on off stump, Collingwood defends solidly
too straight, not much turn, worked straight to midwicket
flips this one out, pitches off stump, Collingwood defends
straighter ball, short of a length, pushed back to Mendis
too short, Collingwood works it to the man at square leg
gets across his stumps and stabs at a full ball, it rolls in front of square leg and Collingwood urges on the sharp single
reaches out to cut a wide one, but mistimes it and the ball rolls back near the base of the stumps
again he gets across to cut and chops the ball back wide of the stumps and Sangakkara, moving to 30 with that fortunate shot
forces a short ball firmly but straight to backward point
wide ball, Collingwood slaps it down to extra cover and sets off, the fielder collects and misses the stumps
comes forward to defend and runs it down wide of backward point
starts with a length ball on legstump, Shah was a little late inn his shot as he looked to turn it to square leg, the ball strikes his pad and dribbles to the leg side
this time it is Collingwood who is beaten by the pace, he pokes at a ball outside off but doesn't connect
'Catch it' is the cry as Collingwood closes the face too early, slower ball from Malinga. the ball lobs towards short cover but lands safely
Shot! Collingwood pulls a short ball fiercely beyond the square leg boundary, scattering the fans who are relaxing on the grassy banks
short of length just outside off, Collingwood tips off the back foot just in front of point
Shah slashes the ball towards point, thinks of a single but decides against it
shortish and wide, Collingwood looks to crack it past past, gets a bottom edge and the ball rolls towards the off side
short of length delivery, shapes away from the batsman after pitching just outside off, left alone
offstump delivery, Collingwood inside-edges it towards square leg, 'Yeah' he shouts and immediately sets off for the single
outside off, Shah shoulders arms
Shah shuffles across his stumps early, this delivery was way outside off, Shah looked to swipe it towards mid-on, misses
closer to the off, Shah again walks across his stumps, opens the face to steer the ball to third man
Collingwood punches it off the back foot towards midwicket and gets a comfortable single
back of a length outside off stump, no shot offered
good ball, hits a spot and gets nice carry to Sangakkara as it beats Collingwood's tentative push from the crease
what a shot! Collingwood takes on the short ball, swiveling superbly and dumping the ball flat over square leg for half a dozen, excellently pulled off
short and wide, cut down to Dilshan at backward point
hops across the sticks, Malinga slips it down the pads
inside-edged! Collingwood perishes softly, standing up to try and just push a short of a length ball for a single but ends up dragging it back onto the base of off
well bowled, well played! Testing delivery to get first up, slinging yorker on middle stump, Morgan clears the toes and jams the bat down on the ball
steps outside off and gets tucked up, the ball just rolls off his pads

loud appeal but Aleem Dar stands unmoved, the ball was full and deviated as it passed the bat, Shah pressed forward meekly and misses, Sangakkara collects and shouts, Mathew is late to react, the umpire shakes his head .. replays show Shah was safe
comes onto the front foot and pushes square on the off side
full and wide, Shah comes forward and shoulders arms
and again, Mathews serves it up in an attempt to get Shah driving but he keeps the bat tucked inside the line as the ball passes
stabs at the ball after getting outside his crease, then inside-edges toward midwicket
drives on the rise and manages to beat two men on the off side
gets two-thirds forward and shoulders arms
tip and run from Morgan, pushing the ball to point and scampering
yorker on the stumps, Shah digs it out and calls for the single
full on Morgan's pads, clipped in the air over midwicket for one, he slips at the other end and Shah has to stay on strike
low full toss on the pads, worked to midwicket
bad ball, short and wide and Morgan cuts it away for one
from round the stumps, spins down the leg side for a wide
uses his feet and drives down to Prasad, the sub, at long-off
pitches outside leg stump and spins past Morgan who leaves
spins and bounces to get Morgan beaten on the flashy cut
reads the length and pushes the ball past cover for two
topspinner on leg stump, easily nudged away for a single
floated up on middle and leg, Morgan watchfully defends
whats that? Morgan gets across with a premeditated paddle sweep to one flighted outside off stump, the ball kisses the top edge and flies over Sangakkara
much slower, gets some dip, Morgan meets it with a push to cover
googly on the pads, nudged to midwicket, sets off, Shah is harrying off and then stops, turns back and dives but the throw is astray
full and wide, Morgan reaches out and drives in the air over point, the sweeper in the deep, Malinga, misreads the turn and slides over the ball to allow four
quicker ball, no turn, Morgan gets back and pushes it to point
on-drives a full ball off his pads for an easy single
serves up a teasing delivery that spins away from Morgan sharply, drawing the outside edge but it flies past slip and now Morgan has leveled with Shah
cuts too close to the body and is beaten by the bounce
fuller ball, Morgan gets forward and smothers the turn
bit too short, Morgan rocks back and cuts a single
flights it up nicely but down the wrong line, Shah presses forward and bobs up an inside edge wide of square leg
pitched up on off stump, Morgan pushes to the off side
flights the off spinner a bit wider to make Morgan come get it, he pushes uppishly toward extra cover
confident little paddle against the turn, wide of square leg
googly, a bit too full, Shah presents a full face of the bat and Mendis dives full stretch to his right
gets forward and defends it back
bit of bounce this time as the ball turns back in to Shah, pressing at it with a sizeable gap between bat and pad, gets an inside edge between his legs
spins away after pitching on leg stump, Morgan waits and dabs it
flatter, faster ball spins back in and Shah turns it to midwicket
too short so Shah crunches it between cover and point for one
positive stuff from Morgan, stretching out to meet the ball and pushing it toward cover-point for a single
wrong line, outside leg, Shah works it away toward square leg
ah, well bowled! Murali flights it up outside off stump, Morgan presses forward and gets an edge that beats Sangakkara for four, he pushed at it gently that time
no turn, Shah pushes to point and yells at Morgan to stay put
watchful defensive stuff from Shah, full stride forward and all
steps out, Mendis floats out the legbreak, Shah pats it back
too short, too wide, and Shah cuts out to Kandamby in the deep
spins away from middle and off, Morgan pushes to cover
a tad shorter, Morgan gets back and dabs it to cover for one
tossed up outside off, no turn, Morgan shoulders arms
bit of turn off a wider length, Morgan taps it and calls for one
spins back in from middle and leg, Shah works it away for one
tossed up and he comes forward and leaves it be
spins down the pads, worked toward square leg
beaten there, Shah presses forward and the ball turns away
steers a length ball down wide of backward point for one
fuller in length, cuts back in, Shah inside-edges to square leg
swings across the line and picks the gap at square leg
onto the front foot confidently, steering into the gap at cover-point
good shot from Shah, just picks the ball from outside off stump with a lovely paddle-flick and goes over square leg for six
yorker outside off stump just beats Shah's bat
onto the front foot, driving the ball to the off side
flights it on off stump, Shah pushes hard and squeezes it to point
goes on this time, a bit too straight, Morgan goes back and works it
turns it off his pads for another easy single
tossed up too wide and that is called wide
tossed up outside off and he leaves it be
gets forward and works the ball with the turn for a single
pitches it up outside off stump and gets some movement past the bat
back of a length and Morgan gets right in line to defend
and again, no room on offer so Morgan pushes back to Kuleya
opens the face slightly and steers the ball down to third man
overpitches this time, Shah drives through the gap for one
gets in line and defends the ball back down the track
gets well forward and defends watchfully back to Murali
dances out and takes it on the full, finding the gap at extra cover
stays low, nearly shooting across the turf, Shah gets bat on ball
too wide outside off and Morgan watches it go past
flighted on a good length, Morgan gets forward and defends
some turn this time, Morgan taps it to point and sets off
defends to point, slip sets off, Morgan urges the single
clips with the inwards movement and inside-edges wide of square
cuts back in from around the stumps, Morgan works it to midwicket
full toss punched down to long-off for one more
gets some shape, Morgan defends and the ball runs to point
full and wide, Morgan leaves it be, Billy Bowden signals wide
overpitched and Morgan drives it down the ground for a single
sashays down, making room, and drives the ball down to mid-off, hit in the air momentarily but did not carry
floated up full on middle and leg, Morgan clips a single
edged for four! Shah chases one tossed up outside off stump and picks the gap wide of gully to tick along to 43
shorter ball, Shah gets back and steers it to backward point
spins on, Morgan waits and knocks it to midwicket for one more

Murali strikes! This one pitches outside leg stump and grips across with the arm, luring Shah forward, the ball kisses the edge, Sangakkara collects and also whips off the stumps, Shah knows he is out and just waits for confirmation from the umpire
tossed up on middle and off and Prior defends solidly
tossed up outside off and Morgan defends
pitches and goes on straight, again Morgan defends
slower ball outside leg stump, driven to the off side
loud appeal as Prior strides forward, bat tucked behind pad, and gets hit on the front leg by the googly but he was a long way forward that time
defended to the off side
another googly, to which Prior goes back and defends
defends the ball back to Murali
tossed up wider, Morgan reaches out and pushes to extra cover
fuller and faster ball, Prior gets down and sweeps with an inside edge to short fine leg where Samaraweera fumbles and gives away runs, much to Murali's ire
picks the doosra and pushes it to the off side
tossed up on leg stump and he defends
uses his feet and drives firmly down to the man at long-on
short on the body and Prior nudges it fine for a single
pitches it up and he defends the slower delivery back
short of a length and it beats the bat
watchfully stands up and pushes the ball to point
tidy short-of-a-length delivery which he pushes to point again
loud appeal from Malinga but that was high, striking Prior on the flap as he pushes at it from the crease, the ball slides down wide of backward point
skips out and drives down to long-off for one
reaches out and drives uppishly to Dilshan at short cover
faster, flatter ball turned off his pads for a single
another flat one spins across, Prior gets across and defends
uses his feet to a fuller ball and on-drives a single
spins in and runs off the inside edge to Samaraweera at short fine
short and wide, cut out to Kandamby at sweeper-cover
chases a marginally wide ball from his crease and misses
another leaden-footed chase and a miss from young Morgan
pitches it up outside off stump, no shot offered by Morgan
short ball aimed at the body, Morgan gets one leg up and tries to do a Lara but the ball hurries him and drops into the on side, all tangled up he was there
sways out of another short-pitched ball over the top of off stump
good use of the feet from Prior, collecting the ball on the full and whipping it between midwicket and mid-on for a couple
gets a wide ball and drives it off the back foot past cover
slower ball tossed up on a length, Morgan drives through cover
sweeps forcefully against the doosra and goes over square leg
short ball, Prior makes room and cuts it away for one
spins in from outside off, Morgan punches to long-off
angles in from around the stumps, bunted to midwicket
slides down the pads, beats the bat, raps the front leg, Kulasekara appeals very, very optimistically
good length that time and Morgan calmly pushes it to cover
whips a shorter ball superbly between midwicket and square leg
close, so close! Morgan drives on the rise and just manages to go over mid-off's fingers and that boundary raises a great half-century for Morgan
nips back in off a length and he defends it back firmly
goes on straight, gets some bounce, Prior defends
hammered! Prior sashays out and drills the ball past Mendis and nearly takes out the umpire
makes room and chips it over extra cover out to the sweeper
no turn, well wide of leg stump, Aleem Dar signals wide
pitches outside leg stump and Morgan defends it
takes a step out and defends to Dilshan at short cover
googly on the pads, turned around the corner and runs hard
slower ball, full toss on Prior's pads and he works it away for one
too full and wide and that knocks a run off the target
short of a length on off stump and defended
full again, Morgan flashes the bat and misses completely
bangs it in short and he takes his eyes off it, but does well too defend it down off his chest in front of backward point
stands up and cuts a short and wide ball and edges for four
bouncer over the stumps, Morgan ducks and wide is called
four more to Morgan! Reaches out at a fuller, wider ball and slashes it over backward point, reducing the target to just eight
floats up the ball outside off and Prior drives past extra cover, runs hard to put the fielders under pressure
defends this one to the off side
makes some room for himself and drives it past extra cover for four
spins back in from middle and off, Prior backs away and cuts
dances out and drives in the air down to the man at long-on
yup, there it is and its Morgan who seals victory with a nice little drive into the covers
